title: Make starterpack installable into any existing project
description:
## Description
Design and implement a mechanism to install the starterpack (CLAUDE.md, docs/ai_workflows/,
beads config) into any existing project. This should be a lightweight, non-destructive process.

## Tasks
- Research approaches: install script, npx/bunx CLI, git subtree, template repo, or manual copy
- Decide on the best approach considering:
  - Should not overwrite existing files without confirmation
  - Should handle projects that already have a CLAUDE.md
  - Should initialize beads if not already present
  - Should set the prefix based on the target project name
  - Must work on Windows, macOS, and Linux
- Implement the chosen approach
- Write installation instructions in README.md
- Handle monorepo scenarios (multiple projects in one repo)

## Acceptance Criteria
- A user can install the starterpack into an existing project with a single command or clear steps
- Existing files are not overwritten without confirmation
- Beads is initialized with the correct prefix
- Works cross-platform

title: Adopt Agent Teams for implementation workflow
description: Rewrite orchestrator workflow to use Agent Teams (experimental) for the IMPLEMENTATION phase instead of the broken nested sub-agent pattern. Sub-agents cannot spawn sub-agents, so the swarm manager pattern is impossible. Replace with: orchestrator (lead) spawns teammates directly during implementation. Keep sub-agents for all other phases (planning, docs, PR). Also update install.ps1 to provision .claude/settings.local.json with CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1.
close_reason: Adopted Agent Teams for implementation workflow. Removed swarm manager pattern, flattened hierarchy, added two-path escalation (technical→Opus, requirements→human). install.ps1 provisions .claude/settings.local.json. Released as v0.4.0.

title: Automate .beads/ commit at session boundaries
description: After pulling merged PRs and running bd sync, the local issues.jsonl updates but doesn't get committed. This creates a recurring gap. Investigate solutions: post-merge hook that auto-commits .beads/ changes, session-end checklist enforcement, or a wrapper script. Goal: eliminate the manual step of remembering to commit .beads/ files.
close_reason: Enhanced post-merge hook with auto-commit. Added to installer. PR created.

title: Document that .beads/issues.jsonl must be included in commits
description: Add documentation reminding agents/users that .beads/issues.jsonl must be committed and pushed. The pre-commit hook stages it automatically, but agents need to include it when committing. Also commit the currently uncommitted issues.jsonl.
close_reason: Added beads commit rule to commit-discipline docs. PR created.

title: Move docs/.starter_pack_docs to .starterpack directory
description: Relocate all starterpack documentation from docs/.starter_pack_docs/ to .starterpack/ at the repo root. Update all path references in CLAUDE.md, README.md, install.ps1, and WORKFLOW_IMPLEMENTATION.xml.
close_reason: Docs relocated from docs/.starter_pack_docs to .starterpack. PR created.

title: Simplify beads sync — branch-aware GitHub Action
description: Eliminate the 10-step beads-sync-protocol. Beads changes ride on current branch. GitHub Action triggers on all branches with branch-aware close logic (pending-close on feature branches, actual close on main).
close_reason: Beads sync simplified. 10-step protocol removed. Branch-aware GitHub Action implemented. PR created.

title: Add bash install script for macOS/Linux
description: Create an install.sh bash script equivalent to install.ps1 for macOS and Linux users. Should support the same flags (--version, --dry-run, --force), download from GitHub releases, and copy the same file manifest. Needs testing on macOS (zsh default) and common Linux distros (Ubuntu, Fedora). Good first contribution for community members.

title: Test install: build a kanban app using the starterpack workflow
description:
## Description
End-to-end test of the starterpack by installing it into a fresh project and using the
full orchestrator workflow to build a basic kanban application.

## Tasks
- Create a new empty repository
- Install the starterpack using the method from sp-08j
- Initialize beads with the new project's prefix
- Create beads tickets for a basic kanban app (board, columns, cards, drag-and-drop)
- Run the full orchestrator workflow:
  1. PLANNING: verify the orchestrator reads tickets, launches explorer/planner/reviewer
  2. IMPLEMENTATION: verify swarm manager dispatches agents, handles escalation
  3. DOCS: verify doc scout/auditor workflow runs
  4. PR: verify PR creation with proper template
- Document any issues, friction points, or workflow gaps discovered
- Feed findings back into starterpack improvements

## Acceptance Criteria
- Starterpack installs cleanly into a new project
- The orchestrator workflow completes at least one full ticket cycle
- A basic kanban app is functional (even if minimal)
- Issues and friction points are documented as new starterpack tickets

## Dependencies
- Blocked by: sp-08j (need installable mechanism first)

title: Finish starterpack setup: add GitHub Actions for beads ticket tracking
description:
## Description
Complete the initial starterpack setup by adding GitHub Actions workflows that integrate
with beads for ticket tracking and automation.

## Tasks
- Review GitHub Actions from other projects (askkevan.com-landingpage, etc.) that work well with beads
- Add workflows for:
  - Beads ticket sync (beads ↔ GitHub Issues)
  - Any CI/CD actions that reference ticket IDs
  - PR validation (ensure ticket ID in commits)
- Ensure .beads/ directory is properly tracked in git
- Commit CLAUDE.md and docs/ai_workflows/ files
- Set up README.md with project description and link to docs/INDEX.md

## Acceptance Criteria
- GitHub Actions are functional and tested
- Beads tickets sync to GitHub Issues
- All existing files are committed and pushed
close_reason: Setup complete: added CLAUDE.md, AI workflow definitions, beads-to-GitHub sync workflow, README, and docs structure.
